intro: Damrongia sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran damrongia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
